page.title: 18BALNABOTH ESTATE
page.content:
{Balnaboth Estate}now extends to around 5500 acres.It has belonged to the Ogilvys (and Ogilvy MacLeans) since the 17th centuary.Clova and Balnaboth were passed, by his brother the Earl of Airlie to the Hon. Donald Ogilvy of Clova in the 19th century.At that time it extended to 25,000 acres. The Clova estate was finally sold in 1920 and upper Glenprosen in 1957.
In the 1920 and 30's Balnaboth House was let and rented for a time by Sir James Barrie but he did not write any works while he was in residence. In 1950, ten people were employed by the estate, in the house, garden and as estate / forestry workers. By 1960 this had fallen to four and today no-one is employed full-time.
